item.title: Making Sense of React Hooks
item.description: Recently, the company I work for switched their frontend web framework from Vue.js to React.js. I think itâ€™s fair to say that React has a harder learning curve ğŸ“ˆ than Vue.js. Vue is also arguably smarter when it comes to change detection and re-rendering as you donâ€™t have to worry about passing in dependencies to computed/watched/side effects. With React âš›ï¸ on the other hand, itâ€™s a lot easier to shoot yourself in the foot if you overlook the nuances of the framework. One of the distinct features in React.js are hooks.
